moves.1. c4: Most popular start...also looked at Pete's white wins.
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3: Most popular start. Nc3 coveres e4 square
moves.2... e5 3. Nf3: This is also the most popular and after looking at other option decided to go with it.
moves.4... exd4 5. Nxd4: Better to take with the N than bring the Q out too early.
moves.5... Be7 6. g3: seemed the next logical move getting ready to 0-0
moves.7... c6 8. Nf3: With c6 move I figure next move would be to attack my c4 pawn with d5 so moved my N away to allow for open file for Q
moves.8... Nb6 9. b3: b3 covers the pawn on c4 and a4
moves.10... Bg4 11. h3: I toyed with Bb2 and e4 but that would leave a Q and N pin, not good.  As I don't like unresolved issues I decided on h3 forcing a move on his part.
moves.12... O-O 13. e4 Bh7 14. Bb2: Bb2 gets Rook connect after Q move ....
moves.14... Qc7 15. Qd2: I figure that there will be an attack on d file d5 is covered by the 2 Knights
moves.15... Rad8 16. Qe3: Need to get Q off d file. Next move maybe Nd4
moves.16... Rfe8 17. Rad1:
I need a line of retreat so my Q is not in danger on e file if snowman's B is moved I will be pinned.
R also covers d file.  decided I needed to deal with that danger before anything else.
moves.17... Nbd7 18. Rd2:
I should have moved Re2 and then Rd1 to e1 rather than Rd2 because I just blocked Q's line of retreat. Getting ready to move Re1 to attack on e file.






































































































































































I should hav




























































































I should have
moves.18... d5 19. cxd5: I made a tactical error having Q vulnerable to a potential fork so best to take wih c4 I was thinking of e5 threatening N but with the Q where she is could lead to problems.
moves.19... cxd5 20. Nxd5: I have great difficulty when moves become complicated and thinking through all the different scenarios. After about half hour of thinking I decided to threaten his Q
moves.20... Nxd5 21. Rxd5: I ha ve made a big mistake here my queen is vulnerable as it my rook on e file from B
moves.21... Bc5 22. Qc3 f6 23. e5:
I dont do well in complicated endings where there are a lot of pieces on the board....AGE related i think!
I decided to keep applying pressure with pawn....if I can break down his pawn defence then my queen is in direct line to check his K
moves.23... Rdc8 24. exf6 Rxe1+ 25. Qxe1: Nxf6 then perhaps Bxf6 then g7xf6 ....still thinking this through.
moves.25... Nxf6 26. Qe6+ Kh8 27. Bxf6: my king is vulnerable but I had to take the N as my Rook was in peril and the n was too dangerous...
moves.27... gxf6 28. Qxf6+ Kg8 29. Qe6+: Positionally i needed to get Q on e file...This will be tricky as he has two B's and an open board.
moves.29... Kh8 30. Qxh6: I thought long and hard about taking pawn on h file.  My king is feeling vulnerable but i didn't want to lose tempo and I have c1 covered and also if Bxf2 kxf2 and Qc2+ then i move Rd2 covered by N on f3
moves.30... Qf7 31. Rd2 Rg8 32. Nd4: His idea is to attack with Rook on g3 I wouldn't be able to take with f2 as it would be pinned by his B but Nd4 blocks the B ...I NEED to resolve the king's position!
